quest.name: In Crimson They Walked
journal: Lord Hien's eyes are filled with determination.

Lord Hien has his Xaela army, and is ready to return to Doma and lead his people to war against the Empire. Before he leaves the Azim Steppe behind, however, he would pay a visit to his new allies. The most radiant brother of the Oronir, who yet occupy the Dawn Throne, is to be first.

To everyone's relief, Magnai renews his vow to render aid to the Domans without a second thought. The mood is only slightly spoiled when he then begins to muse aloud about whether or not Cirina could be his long-sought moon. You leave soon after, eager to meet with Sadu and to put the awkward episode behind you.

Sadu too does not hesitate to reiterate that the Dotharl will gladly go to war for Lord Hien, and that they look forward to a glorious battle in which their souls will burn bright. All commitments reaffirmed, you resume your journey south towards a passage long sealed by the Dotharl's magicks, but no longer.

Crimson is the dusk and the dawn, death and rebirth. An ending to mark a new beginning. Echoing her earlier words, Cirina impresses upon you not to shirk your destiny, or to fear the storm of blood that awaits you, for in crimson there is life. In crimson there is liberation.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I think they love you, Forename! They really, really love you!

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Like the child and the father, the student and the master, all men need an ideal for which to strive.

dialogue.name: DORBEI
dialogue.text: I...I have acquired a wound for my trouble. But it will heal with time and care. The children are gathering herbs for a poultice.

dialogue.name: DORBEI
dialogue.text: Had the Naadam not ended when it did, I would likely have perished. Thank you.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: At the risk of sounding impatient, we have certain pressing obligations. It is time that we saw to them.

dialogue.name: TEMULUN
dialogue.text: ...You are right. To whom much is given, much is expected.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Nay, do not think yourselves so indebted to us. Was it not you who gave us your blessing to participate in the Naadam─and you who saved my lord Hien from certain death?

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Doma is in your debt, and will ever be a friend to the Mol.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: And we to you, Gosetsu!

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: A thought occurs to me. If you wish to return to Yanxia with all haste, the passage to the south of the Dusk Throne would offer the most direct route.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: The Dotharl sealed it with their magicks during the Doman rebellion, when more men in iron came from afar.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: If ever there were a time to open the pass, it is now. We should journey to Dotharl Khaa.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: But before that, might we visit the Dawn Throne? I wish to speak with our most radiant brother.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Are you sure that's a good idea? I know he agreed to fight for Doma, but I doubt he'll be very happy to see us so soon after we beat him.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Nhaama made us for war, Lyse. Ever since we came into this world, we have fought.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: In the Naadam, blood was shed, and lives were lost. Brown earth was stained crimson, and Xaela wept.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: But crimson is the dusk and the dawn. Death and rebirth. An ending to mark a new beginning.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text:
"We who are born are destined to die.
As the seasons turn, we are born again.“
Thus spoke the first.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: So you see, we harbor no hatreds. The Naadam is the Naadam, and what comes after is what comes after!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: If you say so... The Dawn Throne first, then?

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Yes. And I shall accompany you!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Just like that, eh? Not that I expected them to put up a fight...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Let us hope we do not find our most radiant friend in a foul mood.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Hmm. There are fewer here than I remember...

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: I found him quite intimidating before, but perhaps it will be easier this time.

dialogue.name: TEMULUN
dialogue.text: Look always to the light of the stars to guide you in the dark. For none need walk alone.

dialogue.name: DORBEI
dialogue.text: You are for Doma, then. Go safely, khagan. I pray we meet again.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: The Sun is disinclined to entertain you at length. Speak your purpose in coming.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: <sigh> Humble as ever...

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Should I be humble in the presence of inferiors? I am a child of Azim, and you are not. Your triumph in the Naadam does not raise you to such heights.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Baatu will not be joining us. He was wounded in the Naadam.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: ...His hurts are grave, and he requires rest. But he will walk again in time.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Though it is no business of yours. Such pity does not become a khagan. We are not allies, traveler─far from it. The Naadam will come again, and with it our rule.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: I say again, why have you come? To bid us surrender the Dawn Throne to the Mol?

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: N-Nay. The Mol are beholden to the will of the gods, and they would not have us reside here. The Oronir and the Buduga may remain.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: We are for Yanxia, and wished to speak of your part in the coming war.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Ah, the Domans and the ironmen. I remember our pact. Sound the call and the Oronir will answer.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Full glad am I to hear it. We have preparations to attend to, but will send for you soon.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: The gods are kind! I am sure the Oronir will prove a great boon in the days to come.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Of the dusk...a maiden gentle and ethereal. A dancer in the morning mist. And a warrior besides...

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Look into my eyes, child! See you Azim? Are you my Nhaama!?

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: I...I know not of what you speak, Brother Magnai, but I am certain you are mistaken. Quite.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: We should get going. Right now.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: The dry wind from the desert reminds me of home...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Ahh, Dotharl Khaa. Better late than never.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: How long has it been since they gave Geser to the sands? Is there aught left of him now, I wonder...?

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: As daunting as I found it to speak with Brother Magnai, it is nothing compared to the fear I feel at the thought of approaching Sadu Khatun...

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Am I fated to live my life as a sun without a moon? Is there no Nhaama for me...?

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: Hmph. The khagan and herhis warriors.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Greetings, my lady. We come to you on our journey south, bound for Yanxia where our comrades await us. How fare you and yours in the wake of the Naadam?

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: Many were wounded. Some few to the death.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: ...Resplendent were their souls in the chaos. It was a good battle─a good day to die. Soon we will greet them again.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: ...And mayhap one who went before them also. Geser's seed has quickened in his lover. When the child is born, we shall see who waits behind its eyes.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: Already we must look to the next Naadam. We must grow strong of body and mind, and your war will help us do so. Say the word and we will fly to the field.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Of that I have no doubt. For you are Dotharl.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: There is one more thing we would ask of you... The magicks you used to seal the passage to the south. Will you unmake them?

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: If that be your wish.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: When next we come together, it will be on a great battlefield against a common foe. I trust you will fight with the same fervor you demonstrated during the Naadam.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: Hah! And you, ancient one, will be the demon I know you to be. Aught less would be a disappointment.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: So this path leads back to Yanxia...back to Doma, and the others... <sigh> It's so easy to forget why we're doing all this...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: I will miss this place. Though my heart belongs to Doma, the Steppe and her people will always be dear to me.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: I daresay that woman has never known a single regret. I envy her.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: Do not fail to call on us, khagan. The preening prince and his little yellow band will not kill half as many ironmen as we Dotharl.

dialogue.name: SHAR
dialogue.text: I have never been a mother. It is a strange feeling to carry another in one's own flesh. I cannot wait to welcome the child into this world, and meet the warrior within.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Sadu Khatun has done her part. This passage will deliver you to Doma.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: It is here we must part ways, until the day you call us to battle.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: It won't be long, I know, but...take care of yourself, Cirina. And tell your grandmother and the others again how much we appreciate everything they did for us.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: I will. Oh, I nearly forgot! I have another gift for you.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Oh, it's...a red, um...? Wait, is this a banner of the Mol tribe?

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: It is not the most practical of gifts, but we nevertheless wished to present it to you.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: I do not fully understand what has befallen Doma, or your homeland, Lyse. But I do understand that you and yours have suffered terribly.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: The Mol place their faith in the gods, and in turn they shepherd us. They watch over and keep us. We pray they show you the same favor.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: As it was in the Naadam, blood will be shed, your lands engulfed in a storm of fire and steel. Yet as it did here, it shall mark a new beginning there.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: May you ever walk in crimson. For in crimson there is life. There is liberation.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Thank you for your prayers, Cirina. We shall remember them.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Until we meet again!
